title: Ethereum fork issue
body:
Hi there,

My goal is to make a fork for ethereum with new Main private chain network.I don't understand why I am recieving original ethereum packets and blocks

I am trying for couple of weeks to run my private network nodes i made some changes on ethereum code changing this to files  params/bootnoodes.go and params/config.go

**System information**

Geth Version: Geth/v1.7.2-stable
Go Version : go1.7.1
OS & Version: Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
Geth Command : ./geth console


**Expected behaviour**

Running my geth  without any importing blocks "Imported new state entries" and supposed to return 5 peers 


**Actual behaviour**

After changing in ethereum 2 files  ( params/bootnoodes.go and params/config.go) the current block geth is continuously "imported new state entries". and getting other number of peers 


**My Changes in ethereum code** 

`FIRST FILE`
**-params/bootnoodes.go** 
i changed enode too and ports to connect at :60888

```
package params

var MainnetBootnodes = []string{
"enode://3043abe2ab77c36fe12059baea9c8d42f856a60df3c66c07a156b34588b4c5d12fbf2d665d67336edc86118f6fde1858b4993590b4cf1eff096f549b8b4351bb@45.76.34.21:60888", 
	"enode://dd13f0d2f4c86dffaa133c1ce7e91fa70c5885dbb9ae0a19fcc8ae5706ecb3cb3fa0c309cfbfb5e60d86c70b321251f3f882d25a86dd8d313cf7e48110f51d0b@45.63.57.21:60888",  
	"enode://a077e3f672184dd1570af7137d8d74f6068ab04cc81404dbe490b5a83621755ffee20804f7d81a5ee42aade80e6f97efe70ca8a9cda87f33f6e6f018c4de8ca8@104.156.227.21:60888", 
	"enode://70984041736d9de0728e43dd14ad179ffdadb003f6c3fc40df03f24f3376e8effba94c32a70b02b9e16b01254b8d3633b86ea76c1732df4725d2b66df4cdc8ef@45.77.131.29:60888", 
	"enode://b5116d5078304730abb9a6a2b38d833b9838c50d8947ef8bb017af86baf3146fd227b208101c8fe8670cc160434a699ef1135809269b0cbb60e70bb8e6483c09@107.191.57.205:60888",  
	"enode://621d2122539c02ab4ac537506af78227965cff6d709307a2a7d079ef32af21b0a17890567320eec8a56f4f070cf5248ebf8a5545869fef13fd5255f2a3a92389@207.180.198.242:60888",  


}
var TestnetBootnodes = []string{
}

var RinkebyBootnodes = []string{
}
var RinkebyV5Bootnodes = []string{
}
var DiscoveryV5Bootnodes = []string{
```

`SECOND FILE `
**-params/config.go**

```
package params

import (
	"fmt"
	"math/big"

	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common"
)

var (

	MainnetGenesisHash = common.HexToHash("0xd4e56740f876aef8c010b86a40d5f56745a118d0906a34e69aec8c0db1cb8fa3") // Sagecitynet genesis hash to enforce below configs on
	TestnetGenesisHash = common.HexToHash("0x41941023680923e0fe4d74a34bdac8141f2540e3ae90623718e47d66d1ca4a2d") 
)

var `(`
	.
	`MainnetChainConfig` = &ChainConfig{
		ChainId:        big.NewInt(3856),
		HomesteadBlock: big.NewInt(0),
		DAOForkBlock:   big.NewInt(2920000),
		DAOForkSupport: true,
		EIP150Block:    big.NewInt(0),
		EIP150Hash:     common.HexToHash("0x2086799aeebeae135c246c65021c82b4e15a2c451340993aacfd2751886514f0"),
		EIP155Block:    big.NewInt(0),
		EIP158Block:    big.NewInt(0),
		ByzantiumBlock: big.NewInt(8370000),

		Ethash: new(EthashConfig),
	}
```


**Backtrace**

````
INFO [08-16|10:56:41] Imported new state entries               count=1152 elapsed=5.157ms   processed=252411 pending=7229  retry=4    duplicate=0 unexpected=0

````
**And also i have issue of number of peers** 
```
net.peerCount
4
> net.peerCount
6
> WARN [08-16|11:02:08] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
> net.peerCount
5
> net.peerCount
6
> net.peerCount
6
> WARN [08-16|11:02:15] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
> net.peerCountWARN [08-16|11:02:17] Header broke chain ancestry              peer=bb44d260ff01bb4b number=2  hash=b495a1…4698c9
> net.peerCount
6
```



Please guys i just i dont want to get those messages when i run my nodes neither **Imported new state** entries nor **Synchronisation failed, dropping peer**
I really need  your help guys
**Thank you alot**
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
